result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorge J. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jorge J. Garcia is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jorge J. Garcia was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 040816 paid by county $64.00.
4/8/16 - Sentencing Hearing
Associated with Charge #1
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court
from R.C.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP consecutive to 14CF1278 & 14CM1623;  3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.
from deft.
Amended Info

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  State files amended information.  Atty Breitenbach acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 4/8/16 at 11am.  Bond continued.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by DDA Michael Graveley
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.
State's response to deft's notice of alibi and list of rebuttal witnesses; filed by DDA Michael Graveley.
Submitted by Atty Jerold Breitenbach.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Breitenbach moves to adjourn the trial as he has not had opportunity to prepare with deft for trial; will be providing notice of alibi.  Court adjourns JS from 12/7/15 at 8:30am to 2/8/16 at 8:30am; JSH continued to 1/21/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 11/20/15 at 8:15am and JS 12/7/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
6/30/15 - Preliminary Hearing/Arraignment

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Atty J Breitenbach appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  DDA Graveley states they are waiting on the results of the deft's revocation proceedings in another case.  FPT continued to 9/17/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Jerold Breitenbach. Clerk LE. Judicial notice taken of conviction in 14CF1324. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Burgoyne. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KPD Detective Ryan Pfeffer sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Breitenbach. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 7-17-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 8-7-15 @ 8:45am. Bond continued.
Atty Jerold Breitenbach

158 p.m   Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clk:  LE   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within; set before Commissioner on  6/30/15 @ 915 am.  $50,000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry)

*No Weapons.  *No Contact w/ MJK (dob 12/22/91) , MDM(dob 7/26/95) or their residences.
